intro: Drymoglossum cordatum, commonly known as the heart-shaped moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its rosette-like growth form and distinctive heart-shaped leaves that are often reddish in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocks. Its small, spore-producing capsules are borne on short stalks, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Drymoglossum cordatum plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
